newsitem.title: UK: UK natgas trades on flex market at -14.65/therm.
newsitem.headline: UK natgas trades on flex market at -14.65/therm.

text.p: Natural gas traded on the U.K.'s flexibility market on the weekend at -14.65 per therm, a record low since the system was set up, brokers and shippers said on Monday.
One shipper estimated that around 2,800 therms were traded at -14.63 per therm on Saturday, while roughly 3,200 therms were taken in a different trade at -2.93.

The flexibility mechanism is used by BG plc's transport arm TransCo to balance on a daily basis inputs to, and offtakes from, the national pipeline system. A sale at a negative price means the dealer involved is paid to take gas off TransCo's hands.
